question:
The diagram below illustrates a spring tined cultivator or harrow

(a) For what type of farm operation is the implement used?

(b) Name the implement used:
(i) before the spring tined harrow is required;
(ii) after its operation.

(c) Explain how the vertical stalk helps the tine to overcome the obstruction.

(d) State five maintenance methods for the implement

(e) After the cultivator has worked on the soil, what changes will occur in the following:
(i) soil structure
(ii) soil texture
answer:
(a) The harrow is used for land preparation.

(b) (i) Disc plough is used before the harrow is required or plough
(ii) Ridger

(c) The vertical stalk is strong. pointed and bent forward and thís enables it to till the soil and break soil lumb of hardpans thereby, reducing the lumbs to small particles.

(d) Maintenance of the implements:

  • clean the implement removing all trashes or mud from it at the start and at the end of operations
  • Ensure that nut caps, screws or shields are tightened.
  • replace worn-out parts
  • keep in dry and cool places.
  • joints should be oiled or greased regularly
  • adhere to manufacturers instructions

(e)(i) The soil structure will be disturbed or destroyed as the topmost layer of the fertile soil is mixed with the sub-soil and texture may be reduced from larger particles to smaller ones.

question:
The diagram illustrates a pH scale.

(a) Comment on the pH status of a sample of soil as indicated by the reading of the pointer.

(b) State three factors responsible for alkalinity in the soil.

(c) Mention three factors responsible for acidity in the soil

(d) State two corrective measures of removing alkalinity in the soil.

(e) List five liming materials.
answer:
(a) The pH status as indicated by the pointer reads 5.0 which indicates that the soil is slightly acidic.

(b) Factors responsible for the alkalinity in the soil are:

  • concentration of soluble salts in the soil
  • Lack of rainfall
  • use of acid-fertilizers.

(c) Factors responsible for the acidity in the soil are:

  • leaching
  • use of acid fertilizers
  • presence of acid parent materials
  • Nutrient uptake by plants
  • presence of sulphur in the soil

(d) Alkalinity in the soil can be removed by:

  • use of acid fertilizers
  • application of sulphur to the soil  
  • irrigation.

(e) Liming materias are; 

  • limestone
  • slaked lime
  • Quicklime
  • wood ash
  • Calcium hydrogen carbonate.

answer:

  • I = Common name = Tridax, Botanical name= Tridax Procumbens,
  • Il = Common name = Commelina, Botanical name = Commelina Spp

question:
The diagram below illustrates the reproductive system of a cow

(a) Name the parts labelled A to J in the diagram

(b) Give the gestation period (in days) of the following animals
(i) Cow
(ii) Sow
(iii) Ewe
(iv) Rabbit (doe)

(c) Describe briefly three methods of management care in ensuring the survival of a newborn calf
answer:
(a)

  • A=Funnel
  • B= Ovary,
  • C egg or ovum.,
  • D = fallopian tube or oviduct,
  • E= spermatozoon/sperm,
  • F= uterus,
  • G= estibule,
  • H=vagina,
  • I= cevix,
  • J = vulva.

(b)(i) The gestation period for:

  • Cow =283 days
  • Ewe = 147days
  • Sow = 44 days
  • Rabbit (Doe) = 31days.

(c) To ensure the survival of a newborn calf;

  • The mucus membrane should be wiped from its nose to prevent suffocation 
  • The naval cord should be cut and dipped into an iodine solution
  • Give colostrum
  • Dam should lick the calf dry
  • Ensure proper sanitation of the pen.
